message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.SE, cs.DS

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper focuses on the architecture of embedded systems in the context of the Internet of Things, specifically using the MQTT protocol for communication. This falls under the scope of networking and internet architecture.
2. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The proposed architecture involves adding an additional layer to the system, which could potentially involve distributed computing. Additionally, the research on message delivery delays could also fall under this category.
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper discusses the design and implementation of a system architecture for embedded systems, which could fall under the category of systems and control.
4. cs.SE (Software Engineering) - The proposed architecture involves the use of a critical messages handler, which could involve software engineering principles.
5. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The research on message delivery delays involves analyzing the performance of the proposed architectures, which could involve the use of data structures and algorithms.
